note.p: Career: Joined his half brother Alexander in Aleppo (1750); succeeded Alexander as Physician to the English factory, Aleppo (1753); practised medicine in London (from 1772); naturalist to the HEIC in the Carnatic (between around 1781 and 1789)
References: Raymond Phineas Stearns, 'Fellows of the Royal Society in North Africa and the Levant, 1662-1800' in NR 1954-55 vol 11 pp 75-90
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
